result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Voit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution to be paid as follows:  $330.89 payable to Roundy's (Case 14CM1601) and $417.92 payable to Roundy's (Case 15CM1066).  To be paid in full by 07-01-2019 or be converted to a civil judgment.
In lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail (Straight Time), consecutive to the 150 days but concurrent to present sentence.

Straight Time.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joseph W Voit in court, in custody (OTP'd from DCI), with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to anyother sentence.

Restitution:  $748.81 (Breakdown:  14CM1601 - $330.89 to Roundys & $417.92 to Roundys on this case) - Defense doesn't contest amounts.
To be paid by 07/01/2019, if not paid convert to a civil judgment.

Costs:  $243
To be paid Forthwith - In Lieu of Payment an additional 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time- Consecutive to the 150 Days and concurrent to present sentence.


Defendant to be returned to Oshkosh - Forthwith.

Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joseph W Voit not in court, in custody (at DCI - was to appear by Video Conferencing), with attorney Jess Martinez by Atty. Dan McMurray.
Defense requests the matter set for PLEAS and the defendant to be produced.
Court Grants - Orders an OTP.
Defendant to be produced by:  09/21/15
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
